business-schedule.title: Business to be taken in European Committees
business-schedule.division-heading: Business to be taken in European Committees
business-schedule.division-note: The following list consists of European Union Documents to be considered in European Committees. The dates appointed for consideration are provisional.

european-committee-motion.motion-text: European Union Document No. 15049/09 and Addenda 1 to 3 were referred to European Committee B on 9 December 2009 by the European Scrutiny Committee [3rd Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-iii, Chapter 3].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: To be considered at 4.30 pm on 2 March 2010.
european-committee-motion.item-heading: 2 FUTURE RELATIONS BETWEEN THE EU AND THE OVERSEAS COUNTRIES AND TERRITORIES
european-committee-motion.motion-text: That the Committee takes note of European Union Document No. 15647/09, a Commission Communication on Elements for a new partnership between the EU and the Overseas Countries and Territories (OCTs); recalls that such Communications are consultation documents and are not legally binding; and welcomes the Commission Communication as a continuation of the process of the renegotiation of the Overseas Association Decision [3rd Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-iii, Chapter 1].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: To be considered at 4.30 pm on 9 February 2010.
european-committee-motion.item-heading: 3 EUROPEAN DEFENCE AGENCY THREE YEAR FINANCIAL FRAMEWORK POSTPONEMENT AND 2010 BUDGET ADOPTION
european-committee-motion.motion-text: European Union Documents Nos. 16275/09 and 16462/09 and an Unnumbered Explanatory Memorandum dated 3 December 2009, submitted by the Ministry of Defence, were referred to European Committee B on 15 December 2009 by the European Scrutiny Committee [4th Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-iv, Chapter 3].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: To be considered at 4.00 pm on 1 March 2010.
european-committee-motion.motion-text: That the Committee takes note of European Union Document No. 17691/09, Commission Green Paper on obtaining evidence in criminal matters from one Member State to another and securing its admissibility; and supports the Government’s objective of only supporting a new EU Mutual Legal Assistance instrument that will bring coherence and add real value to the operation of Mutual Legal Assistance amongst EU Member States. [5th Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-v, Chapter 2].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: To be considered at 4.00 pm on 8 February 2010.
european-committee-motion.motion-text: That the Committee takes note of European Union Documents No. 9494/09 and Addenda 1 and 2, Draft Directive on Alternative Investment Fund Managers and amending Directives 2004/39/EC and 2009/.../EC, and No. 15162/09, Opinion of the European Central Bank of 16 October 2009 on a Draft Directive on Alternative Investment Fund Managers and Amending Directives 2004/39/EC and 2009/.../EC; and endorses the Government’s approach in seeking agreement to the Directive.[7th Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-vi, Chapter 2].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: To be considered at 4.30 pm on 23 February 2010.
european-committee-motion.motion-text: An Unnumbered Explanatory Memorandum dated 19 January 2010 submitted by the Foreign and Commonwealth Office relating to a Council Decision on a European Union military mission to contribute to the training of Somali Security Forces was referred to European Committee B on 20 January 2010 by the European Scrutiny Committee [8th Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-vii, Chapter 2].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: Date and time of consideration to be arranged.
